synthesis_conditions.method: Gentle method to gradually increase the pH of the reaction mixture by replacing the direct mixing of fumaric acid and NaOH with a slow decomposition of urea in hot water
synthesis_conditions.yield: Record space–time yield of 3,600 kg m-3 day-1
synthesis_conditions.comments: This method enables better control of crystallites growth, leading to a polycrystalline solid with much better crystallinity compared to the initial recipe.

synthesis_conditions.yield: Space–time yield of 15,200 kg m-3 day-1 under microwave conditions
synthesis_conditions.comments: The use of urea prevents the precipitation of the Al precursor into the corresponding hydroxide, increasing the crystallinity and formation rate of the Al fumarate phase under microwave conditions.
